title: Japan Long Term Prime Rate
description: Bank Lending Rate in Japan remained unchanged at 1.25 percent in November from 1.25 percent in October of 2022. Bank Lending Rate in Japan averaged 4.74 percent from 1966 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 9.90 percent in October of 1974 and a record low of 0.90 percent in August of 2016. In Japan, the Long Term Prime Rate is the average rate of interest charged on loans by commercial banks to private individuals and companies. The Long Term Prime Rate is adopted and released by Mizuho Corporate Bank. This page provides - Japan Long Term Prime Rate - actual values, historical data, forecast, chart, statistics, economic calendar and news.
author: Bank of Japan
